intro: Halopeplis strobilacea, commonly known as the clustered thistle, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairie and woodland habitats. Its leaves are generally spiny and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. Halopeplis strobilacea is adapted to withstand drought and is a valuable component of native plant communities.
